entry.et: Middle English, from un- (probably from Old Norse *und up to; akin to Old Norse unz up to, until, Old High German unt, Old English ende end) + til, till till

dt.un: used as a function word to indicate continuance (as of an action or condition) to a specified time stayed until morning

def.dt: :before 2 not available until tomorrow we don't open until ten
:up to the time that :up to such time as play continued until it got dark never able to relax until he took up fishing ran until she was breathless
